image.altText: Donald Trump and Nick Adams in front of a blue curtain

props.synopsis: A Sydney councillor-turned-MAGA-influencer, who faced suspension from the Liberal Party after swearing at a TV journalist, wins Donald Trump's nomination to become US ambassador to Malaysia.

title.children: Trump picks Sydney-born 'alpha male' influencer as ambassador to Malaysia

image.altText: A profile photo of a young woman with long dark hair and brown eyes

props.synopsis: Police say there's no evidence of foul play in the case of missing backpacker Carolina Wilga and suspect she abandoned her broken-down van in Western Australia's outback.

title.children: German backpacker feared lost in rugged bush after leaving stricken van

image.altText: German backpacker

props.synopsis: As the search continues for the 26-year-old, we take a look back at everything we know so far about her "unusual" disappearance.

title.children: What we know about WA's missing backpacker

image.altText: Joshua Brown in a childcare centre.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne childcare worker filled in as a cook and prepared meals for children just days before police charged him with contaminating food, along with dozens of sex offences.

title.children: Alleged sex offender acted as cook at childcare centre days before charges

image.altText: A mother sitting next to her son comforting him as he cries.

props.synopsis: Health authorities in Gaza have accused Israeli forces of killing women and children queuing for supplements and medicine near a medical centre in the strip.

title.children: Women and children among 15 killed in Gaza medical centre strike

image.altText: a man behind the bar of a pub

props.synopsis: Pubs, cafes and restaurants are legally restructuring to wipe their debts and stay open, as the hospitality industry continues to battle tough trading conditions.

title.children: 22 cents to the $1: How a pub legally wiped debt and stayed open

image.altText: A composite photo featuring US president Donald Trump and a cooked piece of steak.

props.synopsis: Brazilian beef exports to the US would grind to a halt if President Donald Trump enforces a 50 per cent tariff on August 1, opening the gate for more Aussie beef.

title.children: Trump's tariff war with Brazil opens gate for Aussie beef

image.altText: A chart tracks stock market lower

props.synopsis: The local currency has reversed course and stock market futures are falling following the US president threatening Canada with tariffs. Follow the day's events and insights as they happen with our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Aussie dollar and stocks hit as Trump flags 35pc tariff on Canada

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Fentanyl  isn't Trump's only grief with Canada
Capital Economics revises forecast of RBA cash rate cut to later in 2026

image.altText: Three man stand around a placid looking lion in a cage.

props.synopsis: Pakistan is cracking down on illegal lion ownership after a pet lion mauled a woman and two children in Lahore.

title.children: Pakistan confiscates 18 pet lions after woman and two children mauled

image.altText: An unidentified teenager stands next to wire fence and checks a phone

props.synopsis: Child victims of domestic violence have told a South Australian royal commission about being beaten, imprisoned in their own homes and made to feel "unloved", but felt ignored when they tried to disclose the abuse. Warning: This story contains content that may distress some readers.

title.children: 'I'm not very loved': Children share domestic violence experiences

image.altText: The interior of a restaurant with a twisted timber staircase in the centre.

props.synopsis: Court proceedings reveal how young British men have been recruited for "Russian-backed" arson and kidnap plots in London, as part of Moscow's suspected sabotage campaign across Europe.

title.children: Restaurant kidnap plot raises alarm about growing Russian sabotage

image.altText: A poster showing three people dressed in Nazi uniforms.

props.synopsis: A man is charged under laws banning the display of Nazi symbols, over a shopfront poster depicting Coalition politicians and mining magnates as German World War II soldiers.

title.children: Man charged over poster depicting politicians and billionaires as Nazis

image.altText: A young man sits in a wheelchair and holds a guitar while smiling, with a young woman next to him with a big grin on her face.

props.synopsis: ToyNera Macgregor says her son Annan is no longer safe at home due to his significant disabilities, and that the NDIS has failed to provide the extra support he needs.

title.children: Mum pushing to keep son in hospital says NDIS plan not keeping him safe

image.altText: Man with white beard, black-rimmed glasses and grey hoodie

props.synopsis: A nursing student desperate to prove he did not use prohibited artificial intelligence software to complete a workbook says his reputation is on the line, but Murdoch University is holding firm.

title.children: Uni student accused of using AI in assignment fights to clear his name

image.altText: A child's hands hold a tablet in a classroom

props.synopsis: Just as Australians are adjusting to the idea of having their ages checked for social media, age assurance rules are being applied to search engines and many other corners of the internet.

title.children: Australia is quietly rolling out age checks for search engines like Google

image.altText: A crew member wearing a life jacket and holding a floatation device.

props.synopsis: Rescuers pull three more crew members and a security guard alive from the Red Sea a day after Iran-backed Houthi rebels sank a Greek-operated cargo ship.

title.children: Four survivors of Houthi-struck ship rescued after spending 48 hours in Red Sea

image.altText: A fair-haired man with a red-white beard stands in a desert-like landscape looking pensive, his face in the sun

props.synopsis: Based on the classic Isaac Asimov book series, Foundation combines epic time jumps, formidable bad guys and a surprising flair for comedy. Now its third season is here, it's time to catch up.

title.children: Foundation, based on Isaac Asimov books, isn't slowing down as season three begins

image.altText: John Sandeman and baby Mason

props.synopsis: The grandparents whose 16-month-old grandson was killed more than a decade ago says it shouldn't take a crisis to change the nation's childcare industry.

title.children: Grandparents plea for childcare reform, after 2011 death of baby boy

image.altText: a large sandstone building with archways on a university campus

props.synopsis: Jillian Segal’s plan to combat antisemitism recommends giving herself a role in vetoing funding to universities and their researchers.

title.children: Why the government is unlikely to follow Trump's university funding cuts

image.altText: A golden egg in a nest symbolising superannuation.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Australians who invested their superannuation into First Guardian have been told there may be insufficient funds to pay them back. Here's how superannuation is generally protected in Australia.

title.children: First Guardian investors may lose their super. Should you be worried about yours?

image.altText: A light-tanned woman with light brown hair, wearing a black and gray pattern top, with purple light behind her head

props.synopsis: Following the release of coronial findings into the police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker, the head of Australia's national Aboriginal legal service says the NT is "winning the race to the bottom" with its youth justice reforms.

title.children: NT 'is winning the race to the bottom' as Australia cracks down on youth crime

image.altText: The original Birkin bag on top of black glass display case.

props.synopsis: The bag was created for the late actress Jane Birkin. Sotheby's auction house says the amount it sold for eclipsed the previous record for a handbag.

title.children: Fashion brand Hermès's original Birkin bag sells for $15.2 million at auction

image.altText: A large blaze burning on the top storey of a tall apartment complex.

props.synopsis: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy says he has received "all necessary political signals" from the US that American military aid will be resumed.

title.children: Russia pummels Kyiv, allies pledge 'coalition of the willing' HQ in Paris

image.altText: Dr Suhana Mohd has her back facing the camera. She is wearing a flower printed hijab and is facing her work computer.

props.synopsis: A major study reveals concerning levels of Islamophobia and discrimination experienced by Muslim healthcare professionals in Australia. Experts are calling it a hidden crisis.

title.children: Doctors face Islamophobia in Australian healthcare 'crisis'

image.altText: A police officer walks away from a grey hatchback vehicle at the scene of a crash.

props.synopsis: Police are yet to interview an elderly driver over a crash that killed a woman and injured two other people, including a toddler, in Melbourne's east.

title.children: Police yet to interview 91yo driver after woman killed in car crash

image.altText: Montrezl Harrell dribbling the basketball down the court

props.synopsis: A man who allegedly racially abused NBL star Montrezl Harrell via social media has been charged following what authorities have described as the "first-ever successful arrest" for such an offence in Australian basketball.

title.children: Man arrested over alleged racial abuse of NBL star Montrezl Harrell

image.altText: Rinky Hijikata and David Pel embrace as they pose for a photograph.

props.synopsis: Australia's Rinky Hijikata and Dutch partner David Pel, who were barely familiar with each other before Wimbledon, advance to the men's doubles final.

title.children: 'Ice in my veins': Aussie Hijikata roars into Wimbledon doubles final

image.altText: Julian McMahon smiling while wearing a suit with a bow tie at a red carpet event

props.synopsis: A cremation approval summary report reveals the actor, best known for his roles in TV shows Charmed and Nip/Tuck, died from lung metastasis.

title.children: Australian actor Julian McMahon's cause of death has been revealed

image.altText: White mushrooms among grass

props.synopsis: Some businesses say mushroom foraging tours are becoming unviable due to higher insurance costs, as Erin Patterson's triple-murder trial sparks more interest in fungi.

title.children: Mushroom businesses suffer as foraging insurance costs soar

image.altText: Protestors hold up signs which read "Survivors deserve better".

props.synopsis: Allowing sexual assault survivors to pre-record their testimony ahead of trial may mitigate the negative health impacts many experience as a result of the court process, experts say.

title.children: Sexual assault survivors call for change to 'traumatising' court process

image.altText: Two police divers in wetsuits and breathing masks wade through water.

props.synopsis: Searching underwater in the dark for human remains takes a special type of police officer, but it's a job the families of lost loved ones count on.

title.children: Police diver says not finding a lost loved one leaves 'hole in my heart'

image.altText: A red kelpie sits on top of a paddle board with his handler.

props.synopsis: Victorian scientists enlist sniffer dogs on paddleboards to locate platypuses in the wild and increase knowledge of the iconic species without damaging their habitat.

title.children: Paddle pups working to save one of Australia's most iconic creatures

image.altText: Bald man in blue suit smiling from inside walk-in wardrobe

props.synopsis: Mental health nurse Keith Donnelly opens a walk-in wardrobe in a NSW hospital after seeing patients come in sometimes with just the clothes they're wearing.

title.children: Keith's Closet ensures mental health patients have the essentials

image.altText: x-ray

props.synopsis: How closely were you following the news this week? Time to find out!

title.children: Weekly news quiz: A new US political party, Piastri penalised and a cat's shock X-ray
